item.description:
3rd Annual Auto-ID & Sensing Solutions EXPO at the MIT Media Lab

PLEASE REGISTER AT THE MIT Forum SITE

www.mitforumcambridge.org/events/auto-id-sensing-solutions-expo/#MITForum

Wed. March 28, 2012   4 pm - 9 pm in Cambridge, MA

A "super-event" with two panels, 45+ tabletop technology exhibits, food & drink and great networking!

Please note - You MUST REGISTER for this event at the following link:   www.mitforumcambridge.org/events/auto-id-sensing-solutions-expo/

PANEL: Near Field Communication (NFC) - contactless data interchange for mobile phones in applications ranging from retail to healthcare

PANEL: "The Internet of Things". A retrospective on RFID technology and where it is headed. This panel includes two co-founders of the MIT Auto-ID Center and the President of VICS, an industry group for apparel retailers, suppliers and solution providers. 

The NFC Hackathon will be held in the fall of 2012.

40+ Tabletop Exhibits demonstrate how NFC and RFID offer compelling solutions that empower consumers, caregivers, retailers and the enterprise. 

EXHIBITORS

AB Technology Solution, Aberdeen Group, Arcadian,

ArtTrac Technology, Avnet, ChainLink Research, Cognex,

Confidex, CYBRA Corp, DAG System, Diamond Technologies, 

Emerson & Cuming, Franwell, Freedom Shopping, 

GeoHelp by 2du,George Schmitt & Co, ICS, iGPS, Intermec,

ISOBAR, Lynx System Developers, Matthews Marking Products,

Medullan, Metalcraft, Microscan, ODIN, Omni-ID, PEI,

RCD Technology, Secura Key, SecureRF, SencorpWhite, Skycore,

TagSense, Tego, ThingMagic, T-Mobile, UMass Lowell, 

Unbound Commerce, UPM, VDC Research, Venture Technology, 

VICS, Wavemark, Xerafy, Zebra Technologies, PLUS many others!

QUESTIONS - please contact Event Organizer Tom Coyle 781.290.7468, tcoyle77@yahoo.com

AGENDA

Panel sessions:

  • 4:00 - 9:00 pm - EXHIBITS OPEN!
  • 4:30 - 6:00 pm, PANEL - Near Field Communication (NFC)
    • Humphrey D. Chen, Executive Director, New Technologies, New Business Ventures, Verizon Wireless.
    • Bertrand Moussel, Executive Vice President, Worldwide Sales, Inside Secure
    • Yuval Zukerman, VP, Director, Mobile ISOBAR
    • Moderator: Stephen Miles
  • 6:30 - 8:00 pm, PANEL - Internet of Things
    • Joe Andraski, President & CEO, VICS (Voluntary Inter-industry Commerce Solutions). VICS was established in 1986 to provide a forum for retailers, suppliers, information systems solution providers, consultants and third party providers, to develop supply chain processes and technology that improve supply chain efficiency and effectiveness. More than 200 members have annual sales that exceed $2 Trillion.
    • Dr. David Brock, Co-Founder and Director, MIT Auto-ID Labs, co-founder MIT Auto-ID Center.
    • Dr. Sanjay Sarma, Professor of Mechanical Engineering, MIT, co-founder MIT Auto-ID Center.
    • Moderator: Tom Coyle
  • AFTER PARTY - 9 pm onwards! At Meadhall in Kendall Square, 4 Cambridge Center (5 minute walk).
  • PRE-EVENT CSCMP LUNCH: 11:30-1 pm, Joe's American Bar & Grille in Dedham, MA. 
    • Hear VICS President Joe Andraski speak about RFID for Item Level Apparel at the meeting of the Council of Supply Chain Mgmt Professionals.    
    • Register - http://newenglandroundtable.org/

Exhibitor Pricing

  • $250 --  we SOLD OUT of exhibit tables the last time at MIT -- First-come, First-served!
  • $100 for true start-ups -- less than 20 employees (contact Tom Coyle)

All attendees MUST REGISTER in advance at the MIT Enterprise Forum site:

  • http://www.mitforumcambridge.org/programs/p...
  • Free entry to exhibits.
  • $10 per member of the MIT Enterprise Forum.to attend panel sessions.
  • $20 for non-members for the panel sessions.

Join the MIT Enterprise Forum for as little as $85 and gain free entry to monthly events for the Auto-ID & Sensing special interest group (SIG) annually. 

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

group.name: MITEF of Cambridge RFID Circle (Auto-ID & Sensing Solutions)
